etymology.description: 燕(燕) (yàn, "swallow; the bird") + 麦(麥) (mài, "wheat; grain") refers to a type of grain known as oats, characterized by their similarity to wheat but associated with lighter and more delicate features, often metaphorically linked to the swallow.
etymology.interpretation: 燕麦(燕麥) (yànmài) combines the concepts of a swallow and wheat, symbolizing a delicate and unique type of grain. Historically, the character 燕(燕) (yàn, "swallow") conveys the idea of grace, matching the lightness of oats.

examples.chinese: 我每天吃燕麦(我每天吃燕麥)。
燕麦营养丰富(燕麥營養豐富)，适合做早餐(適合做早餐)。
examples.pinyin: Yànmài yíngyǎng fēngfù, shìhé zuò zǎocān.
examples.english: Oats are nutritious and suitable for breakfast.

examples.chinese: 她用燕麦制作健康的糕点(她用燕麥製作健康的糕點)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng yànmài zhìzuò jiànkāng de gāodiǎn.
examples.english: She uses oats to make healthy pastries.
